item.title: Sugar add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "One always has a better book in one's mind than one can manage to get onto paper." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Thomas Mann
item.description: "A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people." -- Thomas Mann

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Find out the reason that commands you to write; see whether it has spread its roots into the very depth of your heart; confess to yourself you would have to die if you were forbidden to write." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "The purpose of a writer is to keep civilization from destroying itself." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Fear not death for the sooner we die, the longer we shall be immortal." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Herbert Hoover
item.description: "Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die." -- Herbert Hoover

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Thomas Campbell
item.description: "To live in hearts we leave behind is not to die." -- Thomas Campbell

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Death is contagious; it is contracted the moment we are conceived." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Sugar add a quote by Antonio Porchia
item.description: "One lives in the hope of becoming a memory." -- Antonio Porchia

item.title: Sugar add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "O serpent heart hid with a flowering face! Did ever a dragon keep so fair a cave? Beautiful tyrant, feind angelical, dove feather raven, wolvish-ravening lamb! Despised substance of devinest show, just opposite to what thou justly seemest - A dammed saint, an honourable villain!" -- William Shakespeare
